messages.text: Thats awesome man, its nice to have someone who knows a bit more about that stuff looking at it :simple_smile:
Note: I was sort of just hacking at the numbers a bit. I can tell what the code is generally trying to do but I plan to look at it more closely later and come up with better stereo knobs for it.
Ah great, thanks!
hopefully that can be of some use
actually, I used this tutorial, <http://www.sitepoint.com/bringing-vr-to-web-google-cardboard-three-js/>

attachments.title: Bringing VR to the Web with Google Cardboard and Three.js
attachments.text: Patrick Catanzariti explains how to bring web APIs into the virtual reality world using Google Cardboard, JavaScript and three.js.
attachments.fallback: SitePoint: Bringing VR to the Web with Google Cardboard and Three.js

messages.text: I don’t know that anyone in 8i has a better idea than me
that code was copied from <http://threejs.org/examples/js/effects/StereoEffect.js>
ok cool no prob. I can mess around deeper in the code. :simple_smile: Or let me know if there's anyone who knows some of that part more. (Kieran?)
mmm, I’m a bit out of my depth :wink:
Is that what "focalLength" in the code is? That name isn't right but the comments indicate so...
the target is initially 0,0,0 so I think it depends on the asset
(In stereography this would be called the convergence plane.)
Or maybe the target isn't at the same distance as subject?

Do the two stereo cameras each look at their own target or the same target? I increased the IO but the subject began to separate too much. I want to be able to incease the IO but have the subject stay in the same relative position in camera space.
so I believe that would mean angle in
the controls we use have a target vector and the camera is set to look towards that at all times
I just realized something about the cameras: do you know if the cameras are pointing in parallel directions? Or do they angle-in towards the subject?
Cool
Ok cool. Working. I can adjust the source file and see changes.
Cool, working!
Alright, its up and running now <http://jon.dev.8i.com/cardboard-demo>
sweet, I’ll do that and let you know
Nah. You could bounce it to WebPlatform.
is that still useful?
It looks like <http://jon.dev.8i.com|jon.dev.8i.com> is using the ~/projects/Chimera/Web folder
Yea, he mentioned you were going to
(Er, I just realized you weren't on an earlier thread where I was talking about this, but I think Pan may have told you I was gonna test it?)
let me have a look

Hey, so I was gonna try to mess around with the IO in my own checkout via <http://jon.dev.8i.com|jon.dev.8i.com>. I've got the web-cardboard branch checked out under ~/projects/WebPlatform. Do I need to do anything to get the web server running, or do you or Pan have to?
whats up?
